description:
Actinomadura roseirufa is a species of actinobacteria, a group of Gram-positive bacteria known for their filamentous growth and production of various secondary metabolites. This species was first isolated from soil samples collected in Thailand.

Actinomadura roseirufa is an aerobic, non-spore-forming bacterium that forms branched, substrate and aerial mycelia. The substrate mycelia are reddish-brown in color, while the aerial mycelia appear pinkish-red. The cells are typically rod-shaped and non-motile.

Phylogenetically, Actinomadura roseirufa belongs to the genus Actinomadura, which is characterized by the production of chemotype III cell wall and the presence of the sugar madurose in the cell wall. The genome of Actinomadura roseirufa has been sequenced, providing insights into its genetic potential and biosynthetic capabilities.

This species is known to produce various secondary metabolites, including antibiotics and other bioactive compounds, which may have potential applications in the pharmaceutical and biotechnological industries. The study of Actinomadura roseirufa and other members of the genus Actinomadura continues to contribute to our understanding of microbial diversity and their potential for natural product discovery.
